intro: Costus speciosus var. glaber, commonly known as the smooth costus, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Zingiberaceae family, which includes ginger and turmeric. The plant features tall, slender stems with broad, lance-shaped leaves that are smooth and glossy. Its inflorescence consists of clusters of fragrant, yellowish-white flowers. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
